channel.title: Occupy event has gone violent
channel.description:
This happened within the past hour(probably last 15 minutes?)
Live feed here: http://emergencystream.com/index.html
Edit: Streams keep going down
I'll rephrase what I said, still nonviolent atm but people are forming mobs and running through police barricades, running around the city etc. Not sure what will happen in the next few hours

item.title: Occupy event has gone violent
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Apparently obstruction = violence these days

Read full topic

item.title: Occupy event has gone violent
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:31, topic:419670”]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6AdDLhPwpp4

This makes me rather angry. It’s so unnecessary.[/quote]

Cops like that should be ashamed of themselves. The police is there to prevent violence, not to be the aggressor. It’s funny to see how our leaders condemn the way dictators in the Middle East and Asia deal with protests, but in the mean time they allow this to happen. We have a constitutional right to protest, and as long as it’s non-violent the police shouldn’t meddle with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Occupy event has gone violent
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

That’s called protesting

Read full topic

item.title: Occupy event has gone violent
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:31, topic:419670”]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6AdDLhPwpp4

This makes me rather angry. It’s so unnecessary.[/quote]

As much as I don’t agree with the protests, this was very uncalled for. It was also pretty obvious that they were going to be sprayed so the people are also fucking stupid for just sitting there.

Read full topic

item.title: Occupy event has gone violent
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

So first there was no impact from the higher ups on how police operate, and now its just “not as one on one” (whatever that means)? Which is it?

Read full topic

item.title: Occupy event has gone violent
item.dc:creator: @mormonman mormonman
item.description:
@mormonman wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:34, topic:419670”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=522215.msg3822103#msg3822103 date=1321882997]

Complete rubbish.
It’s not a regular job, it’s a job that involves protecting the rich and preserving the system.
They will be a cunt to you if you try to change the world for the better.

Normal patrol cops don’t give a shit about the “protect the rich and preserve the system” idea. They just work. It’s the higher ups that have real authority that usually end up being scumbags.

The higher ups that pay their wages and choose their promotions. Nope, can’t see their behaviour being impacted by those guys.
[/quote]
its not as one on one as you make it seem =[/quote]
Exactly.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Phillipe Phillipé
item.description:
@Phillipe wrote:

I don’t get the “All police are cunts” ground people are taking, they’re just regular people doing their job - admittedly, in some cases like this what they’ve done is bad but that doesn’t warrant it being the same for all police officers.

Just regular guiz, doin regular jobs, takin yo shit’.

dont be a cunt with them and they won’t be a cunt with you, dickheads.

item.title: Occupy event has gone violent

Police officers are also working men, also part of the 99%
It’s just their work that involves defending the rich against the poor and preserving a system that puts profit before people.

item.title: Occupy event has gone violent
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I also think the police are great people, and all of them there are doing their job. It really is less than 1% who do stupid shit such as firing tear gas at people who are trying to help a severely injured person. But, he won’t be punished. If he is, it will be a paid suspension. Wait, isn’t that a reward?

A drunk driving cop in my town had 6 months paid suspension. What. The. Fuck. To be fair, he wasn’t convicted. Why? Because the police forgot to breathalyse him. What. The. Fuck. He was suspended for admitting to having drank a few. The bartender recalled serving him around 8 drinks.

[quote=“Mopman, post:24, topic:419670”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=522215.msg3809254#msg3809254 date=1320762649]
I like American police when they pull me over for speeding I just cry and I don’t get a ticket
[/quote]

Would this work for guys?[/quote]

No… but dont be a smart ass and they will usually let you off. That’s my problem, since they usually first take the tough cop approach and my adrenaline pumps.

Read full topic

Just like anything else, you only see the worst 1% of anything. Most American police are great people.
